summary: This is an email chain between attorneys regarding the response to a grand jury subpoena for prior wills and trusts of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence shows the law firm Hughes Hubbard & Reed representing the executors of Epstein's estate and negotiating the scope of document production with a government attorney.

persons.name: Marc A. Weinstein
persons.role: Partner and Chair of White Collar Defense at Hughes Hubbard & Reed LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, corresponding with a government attorney about producing Epstein's prior wills and trusts in response to a grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Copied on the email correspondence regarding the grand jury subpoena response for Jeffrey Epstein's estate documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the grand jury investigation; his prior wills and trusts are being subpoenaed.

connections.description: Weinstein's law firm represents the executors of Epstein's estate, indicating a posthumous attorney-client relationship with the estate.
Colleagues or legal counterparts copied on the same correspondence regarding the Epstein estate subpoena.

events.title: Grand jury subpoenas issued to Epstein estate executors
events.description: Grand jury subpoenas were issued to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, requesting documents.

events.title: Production of Epstein's prior wills
events.description: Marc Weinstein produces documents (Bates G1_000103 through G1_000197) in response to the grand jury subpoena for Jeffrey Epstein's prior wills.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 17th floor, New York, NY 10004-1482
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on October 18, 2019, to the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
The law firm Hughes Hubbard & Reed, via Marc A. Weinstein, was representing the estate's executors and produced Epstein's prior wills in January 2020.
There was a misunderstanding or clarification regarding the subpoena's scope, with the government later stating it also intended to request trusts referenced within the wills.
The email chain indicates ongoing investigative interest in Epstein's estate planning documents following his death.
